result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keante Antwain Brazziel

Defendant Keante Antwain Brazziel in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Keante Antwain Brazziel.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense has not received offer and requested adjournment for more time to communicate with defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 16; IN PERSON.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Keante Antwain Brazziel in court with attorney Amanda Kremer for Allison Marie Ritter.  Parties appear via zoom.   Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing in Br 16.    Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  MN  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.9.2022

Defendant Keante Antwain Brazziel in court with Attorney Kramer for Attorney Allison Marie Ritter via zoom.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held OFF THE RECORD.  The parties are still in negations requesting an additional status conference.  The court will grant defense request and order the matter adjourned back to Branch 16 via zoom  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keante Antwain Brazziel in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel advises that they have received an offer from the state, but are still experiencing discovery issues. Court sets next court date for an additional Scheduling Conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision report 04/05/2022

Defendant Keante Antwain Brazziel in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keante Antwain Brazziel appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Keante Antwain Brazziel in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Keante Antwain Brazziel in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
